## Padding

Most layout classes do not have any inherent padding or margins outside of the normal gutters provided with Bootstrap.

If you need to add some breathing room on the top and botom of a layer, you can use the `.miz-layer` classes.

<Canvas>
  <div className="miz-container border">
    <section className="miz-section miz-layer--sm miz-fill--black-200 border">
      <p className="mb-0 miz-fill--black-100">
        <code>.miz-layer–sm</code>
      </p>
    </section>
    <section className="miz-section miz-layer miz-fill--black-200 border">
      <p className="mb-0 miz-fill--black-100">
        <code>.miz-layer</code> OR <code>.miz-layer–md</code>
      </p>
    </section>
    <section className="miz-section miz-layer--lg miz-fill--black-200 border">
      <p className="mb-0 miz-fill--black-100">
        <code>.miz-layer–lg</code>
      </p>
    </section>
    <section className="miz-section miz-layer--xl miz-fill--black-200 border">
      <p className="mb-0 miz-fill--black-100">
        <code>.miz-layer–xl</code>
      </p>
    </section>
  </div>
</Canvas>

If you’re creating your own classes and want to use the same mixin used for this class, use the `layer-spacing()` mixin:
